Uses of Interface
org.jdeferred.Promise

    • Uses of Promise in org.jdeferred

      Subinterfaces of Promise in org.jdeferred 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      interface  Deferred<D,F,P>
      Deferred interface to trigger an event (resolve, reject, notify).
      Methods in org.jdeferred that return Promise 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Promise<D,F,P> Promise.always(AlwaysCallback<D,F> callback)
      This method will register AlwaysCallback so that when it's always triggered regardless of whether the corresponding Deferred object was resolved or rejected.
      Promise<D,F,P> Promise.done(DoneCallback<D> callback)
      This method will register DoneCallback so that when a Deferred object is resolved (Deferred.resolve(Object)), DoneCallback will be triggered.
      Promise<D,F,P> Promise.fail(FailCallback<F> callback)
      This method will register FailCallback so that when a Deferred object is rejected (Deferred.reject(Object)), FailCallback will be triggered.
      Promise<D_OUT,F_OUT,P_OUT> DonePipe.pipeDone(D result) 
      Promise<D_OUT,F_OUT,P_OUT> FailPipe.pipeFail(F result) 
      Promise<D_OUT,F_OUT,P_OUT> ProgressPipe.pipeProgress(P result) 
      Promise<D,F,P> Promise.progress(ProgressCallback<P> callback)
      This method will register ProgressCallback so that when a Deferred object is notified of progress (Deferred.notify(Object)), ProgressCallback will be triggered.
      Promise<D,F,P> Deferred.promise()
      Return an Promise instance (i.e., an observer).
      Promise<D,java.lang.Throwable,P> DeferredFutureTask.promise() 
      Promise<D,F,P> Promise.then(DoneCallback<D> doneCallback)
      Equivalent to done(DoneCallback)
      Promise<D,F,P> Promise.then(DoneCallback<D> doneCallback, FailCallback<F> failCallback)
      Equivalent to done(DoneCallback) and then FailCallback
      Promise<D,F,P> Promise.then(DoneCallback<D> doneCallback, FailCallback<F> failCallback, ProgressCallback<P> progressCallback)
      Equivalent to done(DoneCallback), then FailCallback, then progress(ProgressCallback)
      <D_OUT,F_OUT,P_OUT> 
      Promise<D_OUT,F_OUT,P_OUT>      		 Promise.then(DoneFilter<D,D_OUT> doneFilter)
      Equivalent to then(doneFilter, null, null)
      <D_OUT,F_OUT,P_OUT> 
      Promise<D_OUT,F_OUT,P_OUT>      		 Promise.then(DoneFilter<D,D_OUT> doneFilter, FailFilter<F,F_OUT> failFilter)
      Equivalent to then(doneFilter, failFilter, null)
      <D_OUT,F_OUT,P_OUT> 
      Promise<D_OUT,F_OUT,P_OUT>      		 Promise.then(DoneFilter<D,D_OUT> doneFilter, FailFilter<F,F_OUT> failFilter, ProgressFilter<P,P_OUT> progressFilter)
      If any of the filter is not specified, a default No Op filter would be used.
      <D_OUT,F_OUT,P_OUT> 
      Promise<D_OUT,F_OUT,P_OUT>      		 Promise.then(DonePipe<D,D_OUT,F_OUT,P_OUT> donePipe)
      Equivalent to then(DonePipe, null, null)
      <D_OUT,F_OUT,P_OUT> 
      Promise<D_OUT,F_OUT,P_OUT>      		 Promise.then(DonePipe<D,D_OUT,F_OUT,P_OUT> donePipe, FailPipe<F,D_OUT,F_OUT,P_OUT> failPipe)
      Equivalent to then(DonePipe, FailPipe, null)
      <D_OUT,F_OUT,P_OUT> 
      Promise<D_OUT,F_OUT,P_OUT>      		 Promise.then(DonePipe<D,D_OUT,F_OUT,P_OUT> donePipe, FailPipe<F,D_OUT,F_OUT,P_OUT> failPipe, ProgressPipe<P,D_OUT,F_OUT,P_OUT> progressPipe)
      This method is similar to JQuery's pipe() method, where a new Promise is returned by the the pipe filter instead of the original.
      Promise<org.jdeferred.multiple.MultipleResults,org.jdeferred.multiple.OneReject,org.jdeferred.multiple.MasterProgress> DeferredManager.when(java.util.concurrent.Callable<?>... callables)
      Wraps Callable with DeferredFutureTask
      <D> Promise<D,java.lang.Throwable,java.lang.Void> DeferredManager.when(java.util.concurrent.Callable<D> callable)
      Wraps Callable with DeferredFutureTask
      Promise<org.jdeferred.multiple.MultipleResults,org.jdeferred.multiple.OneReject,org.jdeferred.multiple.MasterProgress> DeferredManager.when(DeferredCallable<?,?>... callables)
      Wraps DeferredCallable with DeferredFutureTask
      <D,P> Promise<D,java.lang.Throwable,P> DeferredManager.when(DeferredCallable<D,P> callable)
      Wraps DeferredCallable with DeferredFutureTask
      Promise<org.jdeferred.multiple.MultipleResults,org.jdeferred.multiple.OneReject,org.jdeferred.multiple.MasterProgress> DeferredManager.when(DeferredFutureTask<?,?>... tasks)
      May or may not submit DeferredFutureTask for execution.
      <D,P> Promise<D,java.lang.Throwable,P> DeferredManager.when(DeferredFutureTask<D,P> task)
      May or may not submit DeferredFutureTask for execution.
      Promise<org.jdeferred.multiple.MultipleResults,org.jdeferred.multiple.OneReject,org.jdeferred.multiple.MasterProgress> DeferredManager.when(DeferredRunnable<?>... runnables)
      Wraps DeferredRunnable with DeferredFutureTask
      <P> Promise<java.lang.Void,java.lang.Throwable,P> DeferredManager.when(DeferredRunnable<P> runnable)
      Wraps DeferredRunnable with DeferredFutureTask
      Promise<org.jdeferred.multiple.MultipleResults,org.jdeferred.multiple.OneReject,org.jdeferred.multiple.MasterProgress> DeferredManager.when(java.util.concurrent.Future<?>... futures) 
      <D> Promise<D,java.lang.Throwable,java.lang.Void> DeferredManager.when(java.util.concurrent.Future<D> future)
      Wraps Future and waits for Future.get() to return a result in the background.
      Promise<org.jdeferred.multiple.MultipleResults,org.jdeferred.multiple.OneReject,org.jdeferred.multiple.MasterProgress> DeferredManager.when(Promise... promises)
      This will return a special Promise called MasterDeferredObject.
      <D,F,P> Promise<D,F,P> DeferredManager.when(Promise<D,F,P> promise)
      Simply returns the promise.
      Promise<org.jdeferred.multiple.MultipleResults,org.jdeferred.multiple.OneReject,org.jdeferred.multiple.MasterProgress> DeferredManager.when(java.lang.Runnable... runnables)
      Wraps Runnable with DeferredFutureTask
      Promise<java.lang.Void,java.lang.Throwable,java.lang.Void> DeferredManager.when(java.lang.Runnable runnable)
      Wraps Runnable with DeferredFutureTask.
      Methods in org.jdeferred with parameters of type Promise

      Promise<org.jdeferred.multiple.MultipleResults,org.jdeferred.multiple.OneReject,org.jdeferred.multiple.MasterProgress> DeferredManager.when(Promise... promises)
      This will return a special Promise called MasterDeferredObject.
      <D,F,P> Promise<D,F,P> DeferredManager.when(Promise<D,F,P> promise)
      Simply returns the promise.
